revision.comment: Created page with "Possibly: The Christian's Magazine, or Treasure. Containing, a choice collection of many remarkable passages upon several important religious subjects, taken out of the writ..."
revision.text: Possibly: The Christian's Magazine, or Treasure. Containing, a choice collection of many remarkable passages upon several important religious subjects, taken out of the writings of some of the most eminent divines: tending to our confirmation both in the belief and practice of the true Christian religion, against atheists, deists, socinians, papists, and other corrupt and loose Christians. By James Mauclerc. (London : Printed for the author, By S. Richardson; and sold at this house in Orange-Street near Leicester Fields, and at the Sign of Eramus's Head, in the Strand, [1754?]) http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b2409548~S1
